intro: Corispermum stenopterum, commonly known as the narrow-winged sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with small, orbicular leaves and inconspicuous flowers. It produces small, dry fruits called capsules that contain several seeds. Corispermum stenopterum is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often growing in sandy or saline soils.
